c74object.name: fl.lookup~
c74object.digest: Lookup values from one input using a table provided at another
c74object.description: The first input is interpreted as the positions to read from the table at the second. The output is the same length as the frame at the first input. The scale, edges and bound parameters control the mapping of the input to the table. The lookup can be performed with different types of interpolation (or none). Only the first input triggers output.

entry.name: /scale [enum]
entry.description:
[0] - samples [1] - normalised [2] - bipolar
Sets the scaling of the input for lookup:
samples - the input is read as sample indices for reading from the table.
normalised - the input range [0 to 1] is mapped across the table.
bipolar - the input range [-1 to 1] is mapped across the table.
Note that the edge parameter is also accounted for normalised and bipolar modes. This adjusts the scaling to work sensibly with cyclical modes.

entry.name: /edges [enum]
entry.description:
[0] - zero [1] - extend [2] - wrap [3] - fold [4] - mirror [5] - extrapolate
Sets the edge behaviour for both interpolation and lookup:
zero - values beyond the edges of the table are treated as zeros.
extend - the edge values are extended infinitely in either direction.
wrap - values are treated as wrapped or cyclical.
fold - values are folded at edges without repetition of the edge values.
mirror - values are mirrored at edges with the edge values repeated.
extrapolate - values out of range are extrapolated via interpolation.

entry.name: /bound [bool]
entry.description: Sets whether lookup is bounded to the edges of the table, or can extend beyond it.

entry.name: /interp [enum]
entry.description:
[0] - none [1] - linear [2] - hermite [3] - bspline [4] - lagrange
Sets the interpolation mode:
none - no interpolation.
linear - linear interpolation.
hermite - cubic hermite interpolation.
bspline - cubic bspline interpolation.
lagrange - cubic lagrange interpolation.

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.lookup~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else, a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.lookup~. When set to 0 fl.lookup~ can form part of a non-realtime network for processing in message threads, using buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.lookup~.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
